snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said he would no longer seek public money for prison classes because of opposition from lawmakers.
abstract: New York State Gov Andrew M Cuomo says that he will no longer seek public money to pay for college classes for prison inmates due to opposition from lawmakers; acknowledges that highly promoted proposal, which sought to attack problem of high rates of recidivism, is too politically controversial.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said he would no longer seek public money for prison classes because of opposition from lawmakers.

headline.main: Cuomo Drops Plan to Use State Money to Pay for College Classes for Inmates
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Drops Plan to Use State Money to Pay for College Classes for Inmates
